intro: Astragalus rubrolineatus, commonly known as the red-lined milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the arid and semi-arid regions of western North America, particularly in the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from pink to purple. Its leaves are typically pinnately compound, and the plant produces small, hairy pods that contain several seeds. Astragalus rubrolineatus is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
